gurmukhi: ਮਾਨੋ ਬਿਸਾਲ ਬੜਵਾਨਲ ਜੁਅਾਲ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਕੇ ਮੱਧਿ ਬਿਰਾਜਤ ੳੁੱਧੰ ॥੩੩॥੧੧੦॥
transliteration: Maano Bidaal Badvaanal Juaal Samounndra Ke Maddh(i) Biraajat Uddhan||33||110||
translation: The rising flames of fire extended in midst of the ocean.33.110.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰ ਰਹੀ ਭਵ ਭੂਰ ਧਨੁਰ ਧੁਨਿ ਧੂਰ ੳੁਡੀ ਨਭ ਮੰਡਲ ਛਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Poor Rahoo Bhav Bhoor Dhanur Dhoun(i) Dhoor Udoo Nabh Mounndal Chhaado||
translation: The sound of the bow permeates the whole universe and the flying dust of the battlefield hath spread over the whole firmament.

gurmukhi: ਨੂਰ ਭਰੇ ਮੁਖ ਮਾਰ ਗਿਰੇ ਰਣ ਹੂਰਨ ਹੇਰ ਹੀਯੋ ਹੁਲਸਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Noor Bhare Moukh Maar Gire Ran Hooran Her Hooyo Hulsaayo||
translation: The brightened faces have fallen after receinging blows and seeing them the hearts of the vampires have been pleased.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਣ ਰੋਸ ਭਰੇ ਅਰ ਤੂਰਣ ਪੂਰਿ ਪਰੇ ਰਣ ਭੂਮਿ ਸੁਹਾਯੋ ॥
transliteration: Pooran Ros Bhare R Tooran Poor(i) Dare Ran Bhoom(i) Suhaayo||
translation: The forces of the extremely infuriated enemiesare elegantly stationed in the whole battlefield;

gurmukhi: ਚੂਰ ਭੲੇ ਅਰਿ ਰੂਰੇ ਗਿਰੇ ਭਟ ਚੂਰਣ ਜਾਨੁਕ ਬੈਦ ਬਨਾਯੋ ॥੩੪॥੧੧੧॥
transliteration: Choor Bhae Ar(i) Roore Gire Bhat Chooran Jaajoum Baid Banyo||34||111||
translation: And winsome and youthful warriors are falling in bits in this mannera s thouth the apothecary after grinding the earth, hath prepared the digestive medicine (Churan).34.111.
The sounds of the blows of the daggers and swords are being heard.
The sounds of the shafts and gunshots are being heard.
Various sounds of musical instruments are resounding.
The warriors are roaring and shouting loudly.35.112.
The great heroes have been struck.
And the brave fighters are belching.36.113.

transliteration: Chaagaddan Chaoupe Bagaddan Booran|| Maagaddan Mdare Tanan Tichchh Tooran||
translation: The worriors seem pleased on shooting sharp arrows on the bodies.
